item.title: OpenAI 称马斯克必须停止 "无情 "的伤害行动
item.description: OpenAI 指责埃隆-马斯克在一年多的时间里 "无情地 "破坏这家初创公司，并敦促法院命令他停止这样做。【原文：OpenAI accused Elon Musk of waging a “relentless” campaign for more than a year to damage the startup and urged a court to order him to stop.】

item.title: 华尔街顾问保罗-阿特金斯被任命为美国证券交易委员会主席
item.description: 美国参议院确认保罗-阿特金斯为美国证券交易委员会主席，在唐纳德-特朗普总统全面征收关税引发市场动荡仅一周后，他就迎来了这一职位。【原文：The US Senate confirmed Paul Atkins as chair of the US Securities and Exchange Commission, ushering him into the role only a week after President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs unleashed market turmoil.】

item.title: 美联储倾向于抑制通胀，避免先发制人的降息行动
item.description: 即使劳动力市场进一步疲软，美联储官员也准备保持政策利率稳定，以尽量降低唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税引发通胀持续上升的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve officials are prepared to hold their policy rate steady to minimize the risk that President Donald Trump’s tariffs trigger a persistent rise in inflation, even if the labor market softens further.】

item.title: 特朗普改变立场后，石油从四年低点延续反弹势头
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对关税计划做出部分缓和，点燃了全球纾困反弹，石油从四年低点延续反弹。【原文：Oil extended a rebound from a four-year low as a partial reprieve by President Donald Trump on tariff plans ignited a global relief rally.】

item.title: 美国通胀在关税影响前将有所缓解
item.description: 美国 3 月份的通胀率可能有所下降，部分原因是能源成本下降，在关税渗透经济之前为消费者提供了一些宽慰。【原文：US inflation likely stepped down in March, thanks in part to a drop in energy costs, offering some relief to consumers before tariffs filter through the economy.】

item.title: 关税缓和后，股市飙升，债券震荡：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普暂停征收部分对等关税，此举震动了债券市场，并提振了亚洲股票期货，此后美国股市创下金融危机以来的最佳表现。【原文：US stocks posted the best day since the financial crisis after President Donald Trump paused some reciprocal tariffs in a move that jolted the bond market and lifted Asian equity futures.】

item.title: 刚刚发生了什么？解读特朗普的关税暂停政策
item.description: 几周来，唐纳德-特朗普总统一直在推进对进口商品征收新的高额关税的计划，尽管有人警告说这一政策可能会引发经济混乱。4 月 9 日，在全球股市连续多日暴跌之后，他改变了方向。【原文：For weeks, President Donald Trump has plowed ahead with plans to impose steep new tariffs on imports despite warnings that the policy could trigger economic chaos. On April 9, after a multiday plunge in global stock markets, he changed course.】

item.title: 特朗普暂缓提高关税后日本股市将跳涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布暂停对大多数国家征收更高的关税 90 天后，日本股市将大涨，推动美国股市反弹，并使日元走低。【原文：Japanese stocks are set to surge after US President Donald Trump announced a 90-day pause on higher tariffs on most nations, driving a rally in US equities and sending the yen lower.】

item.title: 关税冲击业务，戴尔减少电脑折扣
item.description: 戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies Inc. ）取消或缩小了其许多电脑在美国的折扣，这是消费者在关税计划摇摆不定的情况下可能不得不支付更多费用的最新迹象。【原文：Dell Technologies Inc. has eliminated or narrowed the US discounts on many of its computers, the latest sign that consumers may have to pay more in the face of vacillating tariff plans.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克称市场紧张但仍在运行
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策引发了近期的国债波动，但美国金融市场运行良好。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said US financial markets are functioning well despite a recent bout of volatility in Treasuries sparked by President Donald Trump’s trade policies.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税问题上倒退，市场从恐惧转为欣喜
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发动的 "美国对世界 "贸易战使全球股市和债券市场陷入混乱，令人痛心疾首的五天后，他做出了让步，并在这一过程中将金融体系从边缘拉了回来。【原文：Five gut-wrenching days after Donald Trump’s America-versus-the-world trade war threw stock and bond markets around the world into disarray, he backpedaled and, in the process, pulled the financial system back from the brink.】

item.title: 特朗普表示暂停关税后股市大涨
item.description:
美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示将在 90 天内暂停对数十个国家征收关税，周三收盘时股市创下 2020 年以来最大涨幅

。【原文：

US trading ended Wednesday with the biggest surge in stocks since 2020 after President Donald Trump said he’d pause tariffs on dozens of countries for 90 days

】

item.title: 特朗普签署命令重振美国造船业，DOGE 对海军进行审查
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三签署了一项行政命令，旨在重振美国造船业，并将派遣埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的效率小分队调查美国海军在建造舰艇方面为何落后如此之多。【原文：President Donald Trump signed an executive order Wednesday that seeks to revive US shipbuilding and will dispatch Elon Musk’s efficiency squad to investigate how the US Navy fell so far behind in turning out vessels.】

item.title: 加拿大和墨西哥的关税未因特朗普的贸易转变而改变
item.description: 据一位白宫官员称，唐纳德-特朗普总统周三突然改变关税政策不会影响目前适用于加拿大和墨西哥产品的税率。【原文：President Donald Trump’s sudden change to tariff policy on Wednesday won’t affect the rates that currently apply Canadian and Mexican products, according to a White House official.】

item.title: 即使关税缓和提振了股市，首席执行官们仍为经济衰退做好准备
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对部分关税实施的为期 90 天的暂缓执行令周三股市大涨。但总统贸易战带来的混乱意味着美国企业正在为经济衰退做准备。【原文：Donald Trump’s 90-day reprieve on some tariffs sent the stock market soaring Wednesday. But the chaos sown by the president’s trade war means corporate America is planning for a recession.】

item.title: 贝恩资本将以超过 10 亿美元的价格收购 Sizzling Platter
item.description: 据知情人士透露，贝恩资本已同意以超过 10 亿美元（包括债务）的价格从 CapitalSpring 手中收购餐饮连锁运营商 Sizzling Platter。【原文：Bain Capital has agreed to buy restaurant-chain operator Sizzling Platter from CapitalSpring for more than $1 billion including debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 越来越多的美国人只支付信用卡最低还款额
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行的数据显示，美国第四季度仅支付最低月还款额的活跃信用卡比例上升到 12 年来数据显示的最高水平。【原文：The share of active credit cards in the US making only minimum monthly payments rose in the fourth quarter to the highest level in 12 years of data, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia.】

item.title: 特朗普说今天是 "购买的好时机"。他是对的
item.description: 该社交媒体帖子于上午 9:37 在纽约发布。【原文：The social media post landed at 9:37 a.m. in New York.】

item.title: 以大额支票著称的出版商结算中心遭遇破产
item.description: 出版商清算所有限责任公司（Publishers Clearing House LLC）因在惊喜参赛者家门口派发超大支票而出名，现已申请破产。【原文：Publishers Clearing House LLC, famous for handing out over-sized checks on the doorsteps of its surprised contestants, has filed bankruptcy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦称赞特朗普向 "经济理性 "迈出的一步
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）认为，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普暂停提高关税的决定是 "回归经济理性和现实主义的开始"。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s decision to pause on higher tariffs is the “beginning of a return to economic reason and a bit of realism,” according European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 杠杆 ETF 将在收市前掀起 300 亿美元的购买狂潮
item.description: 周三美国股市收盘前，杠杆式交易所交易基金将掀起历史性的买盘狂潮，散户投机者在关税引发的大跌中抢购股票后，将获得巨大收益。【原文：Leveraged exchange-traded funds are poised for a historic buying spree before the end of Wednesday’s US equity-market close, with retail speculators set for big gains after scooping up shares amid the tariff-fueled selloff.】

item.title: 这是真的吗？特朗普暂停加征关税，纽交所交易大厅沸腾了
item.description: 杂音先是悄无声息地传播开来，然后随着这一消息的传出而爆发成轰鸣声；唐纳德-特朗普总统暂停了大部分关税，并搁置了他的全球贸易战。大部分【原文：The murmurs spread quietly at first, then exploded into a roar as the news hit — President Donald Trump was pausing the bulk of his tariffs and putting his global trade war on hold. Mostly.】

item.title: 如果移民停止报税，国税局将损失数十亿美元收入
item.description: 美国国税局与美国移民局达成协议共享数据后，无证工人将减少纳税，预计未来十年国税局将损失超过 3130 亿美元的收入。【原文：The Internal Revenue Service is projected to lose more than $313 billion in revenue in the coming decade as undocumented workers are poised to pay fewer taxes after the agency struck a deal to share data with US immigration authorities.】

item.title: 黑客入侵伯克希尔哈撒韦公司的 NetJets，窃取客户数据
item.description: 据两位熟悉此事的人士透露，亿万富翁投资者沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）旗下的私人飞机公司 NetJets Inc.【原文：NetJets Inc., a private jet company owned by billionaire investor Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, is investigating a data breach after a hacker stole information about some of its clients, according to two people familiar with the incident and an email seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 特朗普关税影响法国经济增长，法国下调经济增长预期
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴德（Eric Lombard）下调了政府的经济增长预期，原因是美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的全面关税政策引发的全球贸易战使经济前景黯淡。【原文：France’s finance minister Eric Lombard cut the government’s growth forecast as a global trade war triggered by US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs dimmed the outlook.】

item.title: 陶醉于反弹的交易员不知道反弹还能走多远
item.description: 整个华尔街的反应迅速而兴奋。在唐纳德-特朗普总统暂停实施他最严厉的一些关税措施后，股市在短短几分钟内增加了 3 万亿美元。【原文：The reaction across Wall Street was swift and euphoric. Stocks added $3 trillion in a matter of minutes after President Donald Trump paused implementation on some of his harshest tariffs.】

item.title: 卡尼承诺加快许可速度，使加拿大成为 "能源超级大国
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）承诺，将通过一项计划使加拿大成为世界上 "领先的能源超级大国"，该计划包括建立一个单一的办公室，负责在两年内决定重大项目。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney pledged to make Canada the world’s “leading energy superpower” through a plan that includes establishing a single office that would decide on major projects within two years.】

item.title: 美联储官员担忧关税前的滞胀风险
item.description: 美联储官员在上个月的会议上指出了滞胀的风险，在这种情况下，即使通胀率居高不下，经济增长也会放缓。【原文：Federal Reserve officials pointed to the risk of stagflation at their meeting last month, a scenario in which economic growth slows even as inflation remains stubbornly high.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停大部分关税后，交易员减少对美联储减息的押注
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统暂停对大多数国家征收关税的计划后，交易员们降低了对美联储今年降息的预期，两年期美国国债大幅下跌。【原文：Traders pulled back their expectations for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year and two-year US Treasuries plunged after President Donald Trump paused his tariff plans for most countries.】

item.title: 高盛认为未来 12 个月美国经济衰退的可能性为 65
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. economists said they now see a 65% chance of a US recession in the next 12 months, citing President Donald Trump’s tariffs on US trading partners.】
